original_solution_mapping.L1: Tony and Dean together read 23 + 12 = <<23+12=35>>35 books
original_solution_mapping.L2: 3 of these books were duplicates so Tony and Dean together read 35 - 3 = <<35-3=32>>32 unique books
original_solution_mapping.L4: Because the books are being counted three times, the book is counted 3 - 1 = <<3-1=2>>2 extra times.
original_solution_mapping.L5: All together they have read 49 - 2 = <<49-2=47>>47 different books

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4473.
    Returns: the total number of different books read by Tony, Dean, and Breanna.
    """
    # L1
    tony_books = 23 # Tony read 23 books
    dean_books = 12 # Dean read 12 books
    tony_dean_sum = tony_books + dean_books

    # L2
    tony_dean_duplicates = 3 # Tony and Dean read 3 of the same books
    tony_dean_unique = tony_dean_sum - tony_dean_duplicates

    # L3
    breanna_books = 17 # Breanna read 17 books
    all_three_sum = tony_dean_unique + breanna_books

    # L4
    num_readers_common_book = 3 # all three had read the same book
    desired_count = 1 # WK
    extra_count_common_to_all = num_readers_common_book - desired_count

    # L5
    total_unique_books = all_three_sum - extra_count_common_to_all

    # FA
    answer = total_unique_books
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Tony and Dean together read {tony_books} + {dean_books} = <<{tony_books}+{dean_books}={tony_dean_sum}>>{tony_dean_sum} books

{tony_dean_duplicates} of these books were duplicates so Tony and Dean together read {tony_dean_sum} - {tony_dean_duplicates} = <<{tony_dean_sum}-{tony_dean_duplicates}={tony_dean_unique}>>{tony_dean_unique} unique books

Because the books are being counted three times, the book is counted {num_readers_common_book} - {desired_count} = <<{num_readers_common_book}-{desired_count}={extra_count_common_to_all}>>{extra_count_common_to_all} extra times.
All together they have read {all_three_sum} - {extra_count_common_to_all} = <<{all_three_sum}-{extra_count_common_to_all}={total_unique_books}>>{total_unique_books} different books

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Tony and Dean together read 23 + 12 = <<23+12=276>>276 books
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 3 of these books were duplicates so Tony and Dean together read 276 - 3 = <<276-3=273>>273 unique books
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Because the books are being counted three times, the book is counted 3 - 1 = <<3-1=2>>2 extra times.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: All together they have read 290 - 2 = <<290-2=288>>288 different books

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '*' instead.
